member.summary: Current log context.

member.summary: List of log context names separated by semicolon that should be received by this async control log from a general API call. Use empty string for context which logs messages that do not provide context. Direct logging to context always logs the message without checking the context.

member.summary: If true, the async process provides a log context

member.summary: Process messages

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.AsyncControl.ContinueOnAnyServer
member.summary: If true, the async process and it's subsequent callbacks can finish on other server that executed the action. Disable with caution as there is no guarantee that non-sticky web farm will be switching between servers, and if it doesn't, the process continuation may hang. If possible, leverage ProcessData with serializable content (Data property) so that the process can continue on other server rather than using static variables to pass the data to the next request.

member.summary: Offset of the given log in the entire log

member.name: T:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.AbstractAction
member.summary: Base class for the UniGrid actions.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.AbstractAction.MenuParameter
member.summary: Contains an array of parameters passed to the control implementing the action's context menu (the path to this control must be specified in the contextmenu attribute). These parameters may be retrieved in the control's code using the GetContextMenuParameter JavaScript function. The columns defined in the parameters attribute of the <actions> element may be entered as parameters using the following expressions: {0} - first parameter {1} - second parameter and so forth. "new Array('cms.site', '{0}')"

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.AbstractAction.MouseButton
member.summary: Specifies which mouse button causes the action's context menu to appear (if a context menu is enabled via the contextmenu attribute). If not defined, both mouse buttons open the context menu. Possible values: "left", "right"

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.AbstractAction.Name
member.summary: Name of the action. This is passed to the handler of the OnAction event as the actionName parameter. Sample value: "delete"

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.AbstractAction.OnClick
member.summary: The JavaScript OnClick function for the given action. It may use the columns defined in the parameters attribute of the 'actions' element as parameters, which can be called by using the following expressions: {0} - first parameter {1} - second parameter and so forth. "alert({0});"

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.AbstractAction.ModuleName
member.summary: Module code name. Sample value: "cms.ecommerce"

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.AbstractAction.Permissions
member.summary: Names of the module permissions which should be checked before the action is handled. Use comma as separator for multiple permissions. Sample value: "modify;manage"

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.AbstractAction.UIElements
member.summary: Names of the module UI elements which should be checked before the action is handled. Use comma as separator for multiple UI elements. Sample value: "uielement1;uielement2"

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.AbstractAction.HideIfNotAuthorized
member.summary: Indicates if action is hidden if user is not authorized for specified module permissions and module UI elements.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.AbstractAction.CaptionText
member.summary: Gets the caption text of the action. Caches the value.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.AbstractAction.SafeName
member.summary: Safe name of the action which can be used as an identifier. Caches the value.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.AbstractAction.Caption
member.summary: Specifies the resource string used as the tooltip of the image defined in the icon attribute. Must begin and end with the $ character. Sample value: "$General.Delete$"

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.AbstractAction.CommandArgument
member.summary: The name of the column whose value should be passed as the actionArgument parameter of the OnAction event handler. If not defined, the first column of the data source is used.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.AbstractAction.Confirmation
member.summary: The resource string used in a JavaScript confirmation. Most commonly used as a confirmation for delete type actions. Must begin and end with the $ character. Sample value: "$General.ConfirmDelete$"

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.AbstractAction.ContextMenu
member.summary: The relative path to a control (.ascx file) that implements a context menu for the action. Controls created for this purpose must inherit from the CMS.Base.Web.UI.CMSContextMenuControl class. Sample value: "~/CMSAdminControls/UI/UniGrid/Controls/ObjectMenu.ascx"

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.AbstractAction.ExternalSourceName
member.summary: Name of the action that is passed as the sourceName parameter of the OnExternalDataBound event handler. Sample value: "deletefile"

member.summary: Gets the value for particular attribute of the XML node.

member.summary: Name of the column passed as the sourceName parameter of the OnExternalDataBound event handler. Used for implementing custom functionality in the cells of the given column.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.Column.Href
member.summary: If a URL is entered here, a link to this URL is generated around the content of the cells in this column. Macros {0}, {1}, ... can be used to access parameters defined by the parameters attribute. Sample value: "~/page.aspx"

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.Column.Icon
member.summary: Name of an image that should be added into the column cells after the loaded data. The image must be located in the folder defined by the ImageDirectoryPath property of the UniGrid. Sample value: "edit.png"

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.Column.IsText
member.summary: Indicates whether the content of the column is of type Text or nText. This is used to generate a special OrderBy clause of the query, so it must be set if sorting is enabled for the column.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.Column.Localize
member.summary: Indicates whether localization is enabled for strings in the column.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.Column.Parameters
member.summary: Names of the columns used as parameters of the URL generated by the Href attribute. Separated by semicolons.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.Column.Source
member.summary: Name of the column from the data source of the UniGrid that is used as the source for the content of this column. The special macro ##ALL## can be used to specify all columns.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.Column.Sort
member.summary: Used to define the column name to be used for sorting if the ##ALL## macro is used in the source attribute.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.Column.Style
member.summary: The style used for the entire column. Sample value: "padding:10px"

member.name: T:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.ColumnFilter
member.summary: Column Filter settings.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.ColumnFilter.Format
member.summary: Can be used to define a custom WHERE clause format to be generated by the default filter. The following expressions can be used: {0} - is resolved into the column name {1} - is resolved into the operator selected in the drop-down list of the default filter {2} - is resolved into the value entered into the textbox of the default filter {3} - is resolved into default where condition in format "[column] operator value" " [{0}] {1} '{2}' "

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.ColumnFilter.Size
member.summary: Determines the maximum amount of characters that can be entered into the textbox of the default filter. Available for Text, Integer, Double and Decimal filter types. The default value is 1000.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.ColumnFilter.Width
member.summary: Determines the width of the control to customize the default width. (for default filters)

member.summary: UniGrid options.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.UniGridOptions.DisplayFilter
member.summary: Indicates whether a filter should be displayed above the UniGrid. If the amount of displayed rows is lower than the value of the FilterLimit key, the filter will be hidden despite this setting.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.UniGridOptions.FilterLimit
member.summary: Determines the minimum amount of rows that must be displayed in the UniGrid before a filter is shown. The default value is read from the CMSDefaultListingFilterLimit web.config key.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.UniGridOptions.FilterPath
member.summary: Path to the custom filter that will be displayed instead of default filter.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.UniGridOptions.ShowSelection
member.summary: Indicates whether a column allowing the selection of rows should be displayed on the left of the UniGrid. This can be used to perform mass actions affecting multiple rows. The selected rows can be accessed through the SelectedItems property of the UniGrid.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.UniGridOptions.SelectionColumn
member.summary: Name of the column used as an item in the array of selected rows which can be accessed through the SelectedItems property of the UniGrid. By default the first column in the data source is used.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.UniGridOptions.AllowSorting
member.summary: Indicates whether the UniGrid supports column sorting.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.UniGridOptions.ShowSortDirection
member.summary: Determines if an arrow showing the sorting direction should be displayed next to the header of the column used for sorting.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGridConfig.UniGridPagerConfig.PageSizeOptions
member.summary: This setting can be used to override the default values offered by the page size selection drop-down list. Values must be separated by commas. The ##ALL## macro can be used as a value to indicate that all rows should be displayed. The default value is 25,50,100,##ALL##.

member.name: T:CMS.UIControls.HotfixHelper
member.summary: Provides utility methods for the hotfixing process.

member.name: M:CMS.UIControls.HotfixHelper.SkipHotfixing(System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether hotfix procedure is to be executed.
member.param: Hotfix version according to the database as applied by the Hotfix utility.
Hotfix version according to the database as applied by the last hotfix procedure run. If is 0 then this value is 0 as well.
member.returns: Returns true if hotfix application is to be skipped, otherwise returns false.
member.exception: Thrown when hotfix version is lower than hotfix data version (data are ahead of actually applied hotfix) or an unfinished upgrade is detected.

remarks.para: Hotfix version equivalent to hotfix data version indicates the instance's files are on the same hotfix version as the database data and the hotfix procedure is not to be applied.

Hotfix version higher than hotfix data version indicates the instance's files were hotfixed by the Hotfix utility and the database data has to be brought to an up-to-date state by applying the hotfix procedure.

Hotfix version lower than hotfix data version indicates the database data is already on higher version than the instance's files which can happen when deployment of a new hotfix is not atomic (e.g. Azure update groups). Hotfix procedure is not to be applied.

The method also tests whether assembly version corresponds to the hotfix version in the database to prevent premature hotfix procedure run in a situation when Hotfix utility has already updated the database but hotfixed assemblies have not been deployed yet (i.e. the instance runs the old assemblies).

member.name: M:CMS.UIControls.HotfixHelper.RevalidateSkipHotfixing(System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether hotfix procedure is to be executed. This method is to be called as part of a transaction after previous check indicated the hotfix procedure is to be executed.
member.param: Hotfix version according to the database as applied by the Hotfix utility.
Hotfix version according to the database as applied by the last hotfix procedure run. If is 0 then this value is 0 as well.
member.returns: Returns true if hotfix application is to be skipped, otherwise returns false.
member.exception: Thrown when hotfix version is lower than hotfix data version (data are ahead of actually applied hotfix) or an unfinished upgrade is detected.

remarks.para: Unlike the method, this method avoids obtaining the version values from a cache as hotfix procedure execution in a web farm environment requires up-to-date values.
See method's Remarks section on details of the individual version values.

member.name: M:CMS.UIControls.HotfixHelper.ValidateDataAndDbVersionOrThrow
member.summary: Validates that 'CMSDataVersion' and 'CMSDBVersion' match (a mismatch indicates an unfinished upgrade).

member.name: M:CMS.UIControls.HotfixHelper.MarkHotfixProcedureStart
member.summary: Marks hotfix procedure start in the database (if the procedure is not already running on a different instance).
member.returns: Returns true if the mark was set, otherwise returns false.

member.name: M:CMS.UIControls.HotfixHelper.MarkHotfixProcedureEnd
member.summary: Marks hotfix procedure end in the database.

member.name: M:CMS.UIControls.HotfixHelper.UpdateHotfixDataVersion(System.Int32)
member.summary: Updates hotfix data version setting (CMSHotfixDataVersion) in the database.

member.name: T:CMS.UIControls.HotfixProcedure
member.summary: Applies additional hotfix changes which cannot be applied by the Hotfix utility.

member.name: M:CMS.UIControls.HotfixProcedure.Hotfix
member.summary: Applies additional hotfix changes, if the instance has been hotfixed by the utility.
member.remarks: Only the main application (indicated by ) performs hotfixing.

member.name: M:CMS.UIControls.HotfixProcedure.ApplyHotfix(System.Int32)
member.summary: Applies hotfix to bring the database data from to current version.
member.param: Hotfix version as applied by the last hotfix procedure run.

member.name: M:CMS.UIControls.HotfixProcedure.ResignMacrosForProductRefresh(System.Int32)
member.summary: Signs all macros (even already signed) of objects that has been modified for service pack with .
member.param: Hotfix version as applied by the last hotfix procedure run.

member.name: M:CMS.UIControls.HotfixProcedure.ResignMacrosForHotfix(System.Int32)
member.summary: Signs all macros (even already signed) of objects that has been modified for hotfix with .
member.param: Hotfix version as applied by the last hotfix procedure run.

member.name: M:CMS.UIControls.HotfixProcedure.UpdateClassFormDefinitions
member.summary: Updates class form definitions and alternative form definitions based on records from "Temp_FormDefinition" table which may or may not be created by hotfix SQL script.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UILayoutPane.ShowOverflowOnHover
member.summary: If 'true', then when moused-over, the pane's zIndex is raised and overflow is set to 'visible'. This allows pop-ups and drop-downs to overlap adjacent panes. WARNING: Enable this only for panes that do not scroll!

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UILayoutPane.MaskContents
member.summary: When enabled, layout will 'mask' iframes on the page when the resizer-bar is 'dragged' to resize a pane. This solved problems related to dragging an element over an iframe.

member.summary: Speed of animations standard jQuery keyword like 'fast', or a millisecond value.

member.summary: If a non-standard effect is specified, then fxSettings is REQUIRED (can be empty though).

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UILayoutPane.ContentSelector
member.summary: Selector string for INNER div/element. This div will auto-size so only it scrolls, and not the entire pane.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UILayoutPane.ContentIgnoreSelector
member.summary: Selector string for INNER divs/elements. These elements will be 'ignored' when calculations are done to auto-size the content element. This may be necessary if there are elements inside the pane that are absolutely-positioned and intended to 'overlay' other elements.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UILayoutPane.Size
member.summary: Specifies the initial size of the panes - 'height' for north & south panes - 'width' for east and west. If PANE_AUTO_SIZE, then pane will size to fit its content - most useful for north/south panes (to auto-fit your banner or toolbar), but also works for east/west panes. You can use either absolute or percentage values.

member.summary: Spacing between pane and adjacent pane when pane is open.

member.name: F:CMS.UIControls.UniGrid.mRememberState
member.summary: Indicates whether UniGrid remembers its state, i.e., filter, page number, page size and sorting order.
member.remarks: Null value indicates that UniGrid uses the system settings.

member.name: F:CMS.UIControls.UniGrid.mRememberStateByParam
member.summary: A comma-separated list of names of query parameters whose values constitute a part of UniGrid's identity.
member.remarks: UniGrid's identity consists of many attributes such as page's virtual path, control's unique identifier or current site identifier. However, in some situations the UniGrid's identity might not be unique, e.g., when the page with UniGrid control is shared between CMS Desk and Site Manager. In this case it is necessary to make the identity stronger and include additional information from the query string. You can specify more parameters separated by comma, or you could use the asterisk (*) to include the complete query string into UniGrid's identity.

member.name: F:CMS.UIControls.UniGrid.mStateId
member.summary: A UniGrid's unique identifier.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGrid.RememberState
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether UniGrid remembers its state, i.e., filter, page number, page size and sorting order.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGrid.RememberStateByParam
member.summary: Gets or sets a comma-separated list of names of query parameters whose value constitute a part of UniGrid's identity.
member.remarks: UniGrid's identity consists of many attributes such as page's virtual path, control's unique identifier or current site identifier. However, in some situations the UniGrid's identity might not be unique, e.g., when the page with UniGrid control is shared between CMS Desk and Site Manager. In this case it is necessary to make the identity stronger and include additional information from the query string. You can specify more parameters separated by comma, or you could use the asterisk (*) to include the complete query string into UniGrid's identity.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGrid.RememberDefaultState
member.summary: Indicates whether UniGrid remembers its default state.
member.remarks: To reduce memory usage UniGrid by default does not store its default state. However, there might be a filter control whose non-default state results in an empty filtering condition. In that case it's necessary to force UniGrid to store its default state.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGrid.HasDefaultState
member.summary: Gets the value indicating whether UniGrid is in a default state, i.e., without filtering condition, on the first page and with the default page size and sorting order.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniGrid.StateRestored
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether UniGrid has restored its state.

member.summary: If true, relative ancestor div is checked in context menu

member.name: M:CMS.UIControls.UniGrid.Reset
member.summary: Resets the UniGrid state, i.e., restores the filter to the initial state, navigates to the first page and sets the default page size and sorting order, and finally reloads data.
member.remarks: When some of the custom filter controls doesn't implement the ResetFilter method, UniGrid displays an error message and logs a warning to the event log.

member.summary: Format of the display name.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniSelector.DefaultDisplayNameFormat
member.summary: Default format of the display name. This format is used if the DisplayNameFormat (after resolving macros) is empty.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniSelector.ValuesSeparator
member.summary: If there is a multi-selection enabled, the returned values are separated by this separator. Default is semicolon ";".

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniSelector.AllowEmpty
member.summary: Specifies, whether the selector allows empty selection. If the dialog allows empty selection, it displays the (none) field in the DDL variant and Clear button in the Textbox variant (default true). For multiple selection it returns empty string, otherwise it returns 0.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniSelector.AllowDefault
member.summary: Specifies, whether the selector allows default item selection. If the dialog allows default selection, it displays the (default) field in the DDL variant (default false). For multiple selection it returns empty string, otherwise it returns 0.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniSelector.AllowAll
member.summary: Specifies, whether the selector allows selection of all items. If the dialog allows selection of all items, it displays the (all) field in the DDL variant. When property is selected then Uniselector doesnt load any data from DB, it just returns -1 value and external code must handle data loading.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniSelector.LocalizeItems
member.summary: Specifies whether the selector should resolve localization macros.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniSelector.FilterControl
member.summary: Path to the filter control (CMSAbstractBaseFilterControl), which will be used for advanced filtering of the objects in the selection dialogs.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniSelector.UseDefaultNameFilter
member.summary: If true, name filter is used (default true), it can be disabled when some FilterControl is used.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniSelector.SpecialFields
member.summary: Array with the special field values that should be added to the DropDownList selection, between the (none) item and the other items.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniSelector.MaxDisplayedTotalItems
member.summary: The number of maximum displayed total items in the dropdownlist selection (excluding the special and generic items). Default is 50. If exceeded, only MaxDisplayedItems is displayed.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniSelector.MaxDisplayedItems
member.summary: The number of maximum displayed items in the dropdownlist selection (excluding the special and generic items). Default is 25.

member.name: P:CMS.UIControls.UniSelector.AllowLocalizedFilteringInSelectionDialog

member.name: E:CMS.UIControls.CMSModalDesignPage.Save
member.summary:
Fired when 'save and close' button is clicked and the content should be saved. Pages that use this event should use MasterPage that implements from interface, which contains this event. This event is similar to event.
Adding a handler to this event will also display 'Save and Close' button at the bottom of the page.

member.name: M:CMS.UIControls.CMSPage.CheckUIElementAccessHierarchicalInternal(CMS.Modules.UIElementInfo,CMS.MacroEngine.MacroResolver,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks the permissions of all UI elements hierarchically starting with specified UI element (with optional custom root element).
member.param: The context resolver for macro in ElementAccessCondition.
The root element ID. If set the access is not checked over this element.
member.returns: Returns type with access check result. If is null, returned has status and its is null.

member.name: M:CMS.UIControls.CMSPage.CheckUIElementAccessHierarchical(CMS.Modules.UIElementInfo,CMS.MacroEngine.MacroResolver,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks the permissions of all UI elements hierarchically starting with specified UI element. Use optional parameter (contextResolver) and macro in ElementAccessCondition will be also checked. Use two optional parameters (isDialog, rootElementId) if your ui element is dialog. In case of insufficient permissions appropriate redirection is made.
member.param: The context resolver for macro in ElementAccessCondition.
Indicates whether not fulfillment permissions should cause redirect to access denied
member.returns: Returns false if UI current user is not authorized per UI element (requires disabled redirectToAccessDenied parameter)

member.name: M:CMS.UIControls.CMSPage.CheckUIElementAccessHierarchical(System.String,System.String,CMS.MacroEngine.MacroResolver,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks the permissions of all UI elements hierarchically starting with specified UI element. Use optional parameter "contextResolver" and macro in ElementAccessCondition will be also checked. Use optional parameter "rootElementId" if your UI element is in a dialog. RootElementId variable identifies the UI element which is used in the top frame of the dialog. In case of insufficient permissions appropriate redirection is made.
member.param: The context resolver for macro in ElementAccessCondition.
Indicates whether not fulfillment permissions should cause redirect to access denied
member.returns: Returns false if UI current user is not authorized per UI element (requires disabled redirectToAccessDenied parameter)

member.summary: Processes a request for a JavaScript module file.

member.param: The identifier of the JavaScript module.

member.name: M:Samples.DancingGoat.SampleContactPersonalDataEraser.Erase(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{CMS.DataEngine.BaseInfo},System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Erases personal data based on given and .
member.param: Collection of identities representing a data subject.
Configures which personal data should be erased.
member.remarks:
The erasure process can be configured via the following parameters:
deleteContacts Flag indicating whether contact(s) contained in are to be deleted.
deleteContactFromAccounts Flag indicating whether contact's association with accounts is to be deleted.
deleteSubscriptionFromNewsletters Flag indicating whether contact's subscription to newsletters is to be deleted.
deleteActivities Flag indicating whether activities of contact are to be deleted.
deleteSubmittedFormsActivities Flag indicating whether form activities of contact are to be deleted.

member.name: M:Samples.DancingGoat.SampleContactPersonalDataEraser.DeleteSubmittedFormsActivities(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{System.Int32},System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Deletes contact's submitted forms activities based on 's deleteSubmittedFormsActivities flag.
member.remarks: Activities are deleted via bulk operation, considering the amount of activities for a contact.

member.summary: Deletes all DancingGoat submitted forms data for and , based on 's deleteSubmittedFormsData flag.

member.name: M:Samples.DancingGoat.SampleCustomerPersonalDataEraser.Erase(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{CMS.DataEngine.BaseInfo},System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Erases personal data based on given and .
member.param: Collection of identities representing a data subject.
Configures which personal data should be erased.
member.remarks:
The erasure process can be configured via the following parameters:
deleteCustomers Flag indicating whether customer(s) contained in are to be deleted.
deleteOrdersOlderThanYears Number indicating how old orders are to be deleted. Omit the parameter to keep all orders.
deleteShoppingCarts Flag indicating whether shopping carts associated with customer(s), user(s) or contact(s) are to be deleted.
deleteWishlists Flag indicating whether wishlists associated with customer(s) are to be deleted.
